trans-unit.source: Represents a text annotation.
Note that other annotations, such as rectangle and ellipse annotations, can display inner text.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAnnotation"></xref> class.
Gets the annotation type.
For internal use, should not be used.
The annotation type.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientStyle"></xref> enumeration value.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle"></xref> enumeration value.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value.
Begins editing of the annotation text by an end-user.
After calling this method, the annotation displays an editing box that allows the user to edit the annotation text.
Call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAnnotation.StopTextEditing%2A> method to cancel this mode programmatically.

Note that editing also ends when the end-user hits the Enter key if the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAnnotation.IsMultiline%2A> property is `false`, or when the end-user clicks outside the editing box if the value is `true`.
Ends user placement of an annotation.
Ends an annotation placement operation previously started by a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.BeginPlacement%2A> method call.
You are not required to call this method, because placement will automatically end when an end-user enters all required points.
However, it is useful when an annotation placement operation needs to be aborted for some reason.
Gets or sets the font for the annotation text.
To set this property, create a new <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object, and then assign it to this property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> object used as the font for the annotation text.
Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether the annotation text is multiline.
`True` if the annotation text is multiline; otherwise, `False`.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartDashStyle"></xref> enumeration value.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.
An `integer` value.
Stops end-user editing of the annotation text.
Call this method to cancel a text editing operation that was started with a call to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAnnotation.BeginTextEditing%2A> method.
Note that if the end user double-clicks the annotation, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAnnotation.BeginTextEditing%2A> method will be automatically called.
Gets or sets the text of the annotation.
A `string` value that represents the text.
